results.title: West Side Story
results.creator_credit: Mirisch Corporation, Seven Arts Productions, Robert Wise and Jerome Robbins
results.brief_description: America, “Tonight”, “Maria”, “Somewhere”, “I Feel Pretty” - just some of the sensational evergreen songs from “West Side Story”, the winner of ten Oscars including Best Picture. Opening with the now famous helicopter shot of Manhattan, “West Side Story” is the heart-rending, brilliantly tuneful contemporary version of “Romeo and Juliet”. The gang rivalry between The Jets and the Puerto Rican Sharks reaches fever pitch when ex-Jet Tony falls in love with Maria, the sister of Shark leader Bernardo. When Bernado is killed in a gang misunderstanding, Tony and Maria become the unwilling, tragic participants in the resulting vendetta. Music by Leonard Bernstein. Starring Natalie Wood as Maria, Richard Beymer as Tony, Russ Tamblyn as Riff and Rita Moreno as Anita. Based on the book by Arthur Laurents.

results.title: West of Pinto Basin. Part II
results.creator_credit: Peak Films, George Weeks and Roy Luby
results.brief_description: Part two of a two-part story. The Range Busters solve the mystery of a series of stage-coach robberies. Pleasant, light western. Suitable for children. Cast includes John King, Ray Corrigan. Silent film with English captions.

results.title: West of England
results.creator_credit: Greenpark Productions, Paul Fletcher and Humphrey Swingler
results.brief_description: A picture of the Stroud Valley in Western England where weaving is still the principal industry even as it was hundreds of years ago. The sheep that once grazed there are now gone, and wool is imported from Australia, but rushing streams still provide water power and the weavers still produce fine cloth and maintain pride in their ancient craft.

results.title: West meets east
results.creator_credit: BBC, Peter Montagnon and Jonathan Stedall
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “The Long Search”.
In this penultimate program Ronald Eyre visits the alternative communities of San Francisco, where westerners are searching for something to replace traditional religion, or the religion of science and progress, which seems to have replaced religion in the accepted sense in much of western society. The fundamental question he asks in this program is “Is God dead and did science kill him, and is science an adequate explanation of reality?” He talks to Theodore Roszak about the quest for meaning, and to noted physicists and philosophers, about the growing indadequacy of science to explain. Touching briefly on various manifestations of this search - biofeedback, sikhism, SAGE and the new physics, he concludes that the search itself is positive, even if the finding is sometimes shallow and negative.

results.title: West Germany: industrial giant
results.brief_description: Covers the regions of Western Germany and the character of the people in the various areas of the country. Surveys the heavy industries of the Ruhr Valley and the craft industries spread throughout the rural areas. We see the mountains, the Rhine, Munich, Hamburg and Bonn.
results.description: Covers the regions of Western Germany and the character of the people in the various areas of the country. Surveys the heavy industries of the Ruhr Valley and the craft industries spread throughout the rural areas. We see the mountains, the Rhine, Munich, Hamburg and Bonn.

results.title: West country journey
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films, Edgar H. Anstey and Syd Sharples
results.brief_description: Shows examples of scenery and features which give the counties of Devon and Cornwall their attractive character. Includes the multi-colored pattern of the Devon countryside; the rivers, moors, old historic buildings at Totnes, Dartmouth and Exeter; tiny ports and naval docks at Devonport and the long sandy beaches of Cornwall. Photography by Ronald Craigen.
